result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather J Diamond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact direct or indirect with victims.

Defendant Heather J Diamond in court with attorney Heather Kavanaugh. Defendant Heather J Diamond in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, receipt of PSI and alternate PSI, recommendations contained therein. Defense advises of discrepancies on guilty plea questionnaire, advises that Defendant does not wish to change her pleas, is prepared to proceed with sentencing. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (not joint). Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
of Dr. Michael Galli, Ph.D. of Wisconsin Forensic Unit

Defendant Heather J Diamond in court with attorney Heather Kavanaugh. Defendant Heather J Diamond in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense requests that Court accept report, advises that Defendant will not be contesting findings. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with Defense. Court accepts report, finds Defendant competent. Defense advises of discussions with Defendant, will not be withdrawing plea, will be requesting alternate PSI, requests sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
from defendant asking what she owes on case.  Reminder Notice sent to defendant in the DC Jail.
for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

Defendant Heather J Diamond in court with attorney Heather Kavanaugh. Defendant Heather J Diamond in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews requests to adjourn sentencing. Defense just got the file on Monday, will likely be requesting transcript of plea hearing, advises that Defendant may not be understanding everything, questions competency. Court questions Defense, who does have competency concerns. Court orders competency evaluation. Bond continues as is.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
(rec'd by Court 8/13/15) from Defendant requesting that sentencing be moved.

Defendant Heather J Diamond in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 3, 6, 9, 11, 15, 18, 23, 30, 33. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 3, 6, 9, 11, 15, 18, 23, 30, 33. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. All remaining counts are dismissed but read in for sentencing and/or restitution. Parties request PSI. Court orders PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Heather J Diamond in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Heather J Diamond in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for reduction of bond. Defense requests that motion be entered and continued, advises that State has agreed to consider motion upon payment of restitution. State advises of mininum restitution. Court thinks restitution should be manageable given motion that states Defendant could come up with $2500. Defense agrees. Court questions Defendant, whose husband is still working.
by Defendant to Modify Bond
Pre-trial conference on April 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Heather J Diamond in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Heather J Diamond in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions whether any progress has been made. Defense requests that case be set for pretrial and trial. Defense will be filing motion for reduction of bond.
from Defendant to Court requesting new Court-appointed Counsel. Per Court, I'll appoint Brett Reetz. Steve Johnson is relieved. Last lawyer appointed. If any disagreements, will have to hire own.

Defendant Heather J Diamond in court with attorney Stephen P. Johnson. Defendant Heather J Diamond in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas, requests status date.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
by State
by Defendant
Defense presents argument for reduced cash bond. State presents argument against reduction of bond. Defense responds. Court will not reduce bond.

Defendant Heather J Diamond in court with attorney Stephen P. Johnson. Defendant Heather J Diamond in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense accepts appointment. Court reviews repayment of attorney fees with Defendant, who understands. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. Defense requests that arraignment be set.  Arraignment scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
for Subpoena for Documents, Affidavit in Support of Request, Subpoena for Documents, Return of Subpoena
Defendant was fingerprinted.
Court appoints Stephen Johnson, orders Defendant to pay $100 per month effective 10/31/14.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Heather J Diamond in court, in custody. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on progress getting an attorney. Defendant is working on getting an attorney, advises that Ms. Korb has mistaken her for someone else, requests lower bond, will appear for Court. State objects to request for lower bond, presents argument. Court denies request. Defendant needs more time to get an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.

No contact direct or indirect with Econo Foods, Blue Ivy, Options, Crickets, Jandu Petroleum. Not to write or pass any checks. Not to use a computer. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Heather J Diamond in court, in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. State presents argument regarding bond. Court questions Defendant on what she's going to do about an attorney. Defendant does not qualify for PD, wants to get one on her own. Court questions State on estimated restitution. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
